title: Heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers will occur at times in the Northern, Eastern and North central provinces.

title: Inaugural Cabinet meeting of new govt today
byline: The inaugural meeting of the newly-formed Cabinet of Ministers is scheduled to take place at 10.00 a.m. today (19) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Train commuter dies after colliding with signal post
byline: A 21-year-old youth who was traveling on the footboard of a moving train has been killed after colliding with a signal post near the railway line last morning (18).

title: Large consignment of illegally imported painkiller drugs seized at Colombo Port
byline: Sri Lanka Customs Revenue Task Force (RTF) has seized a large quantity of illegally imported medicines from a warehouse in the Colombo Port.

title: Jaishankar congratulates Vijitha Herath on re-appointment as foreign minister
byline: Indian External Affairs Minister, S Jaishankar congratulated Vijitha Herath on his re-appointment as the Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka.

title: Inaugural session of Tenth Parliament: How the Speaker is chosen
byline: The inaugural session of the Tenth Parliament is scheduled to commence on November 21. The first day of Parliament’s inaugural session holds particular significance due to the series of special proceedings expected to take place on that day.

title: President urges IMF to strike a balance in Sri Lanka’s economic recovery program
byline: The government of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has reaffirmed its readiness to collaborate with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to advance Sri Lanka’s economic recovery within the context of the mandate.

title: US returns looted antiquities worth $10 million to India
byline: The United States has returned more than 1,400 looted artifacts worth $10 million to India as part of an ongoing initiative to repatriate stolen art from countries across South and Southeast Asia, the Manhattan District Attorney’s office announced Wednesday.

title: President Dissanayake to visit India in December – report
byline: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will visit India at the invitation of the Indian government in mid-December, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said on Monday.

title: Parliament sets up information counter for freshly elected MPs
byline: The Secretary General of Parliament, Mrs. Kushani Rohanadheera announced that an information counter will be kept open today (19) and tomorrow (20) to assist freshly elected Members of Parliament with activities related to the first session of the Tenth Parliament.

title: Lohan Ratwatte’s bail request moved to December
byline: The Court of Appeal has granted time for the Attorney General (AG) to fie objections related to the petition filed by former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte requesting him to be released on bail.

title: Tens of thousands rally at New Zealand parliament against bill to alter Indigenous rights
byline: Tens of thousands of New Zealanders rallied in front of parliament on Tuesday in one of the country’s largest ever protests to oppose a bill, which opponents say seeks to dilute the rights of Maori and threatens to set race relations back decades.

title: Youth drowns while bathing in Theli Ella Falls
byline: A 27-year-old youth has reportedly drowned while bathing in the Theli Ella Falls in Kegalle.

title: What Sri Lankan MPs receive: Secretary General details MP benefits
byline: The Secretary General of Parliament, Mrs. Kushani Rohanadheera, clarified that a Member of Parliament (MP) is not paid a salary but is entitled to an allowance.

title: National List MP nominations spark internal crises in NDF and SJB
byline: The nomination process for National List MP positions within the New Democratic Front (NDF) and Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has escalated into internal turmoil, with fierce competition for limited seats.

title: Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa appointed Cabinet Spokesman
byline: The Minister of Health and Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has been appointed as the Cabinet Spokesman of the new government.

title: Minister Bimal Rathnayake appointed as Leader of the House
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Rathnayake has been appointed as the Leader of the House.

title: Nalinda Jayatissa appointed Chief Govt Whip
byline: Minister of Health and Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has been appointed as the Chief Government Whip of the new government, during the inaugural Cabinet meeting held today (19).

title: Ex-president assassination plot: SC sets deadline to probe former TID Director
byline: The Supreme Court has ordered the National Police Commission to conclude the investigations into then-Director of the Terrorism Investigation Division (TID)..

title: Fertilizer subsidy delay due to technical issues – Agri. Ministry
byline: The delay in crediting the fertilizer subsidy funds to farmers’ bank accounts is due to a technical issue with the computer system, claims the Ministry of Agriculture.

title: Ukraine vows to ‘never submit’ as war reaches 1,000th day
byline: Ukraine has said it will never give in to Russia’s aggression as it marks 1,000 days since the Kremlin launched a full-scale invasion of the country.

title: Minister pledges reforms to boost discipline and recruitment in Sri Lanka Police
byline: The newly appointed Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala has announced plans to strengthen the Sri Lanka Police by reforming its recruitment system.

title: Eight Bangladeshis arrested without valid visas
byline: Eight foreign nationals who were residing in the country without valid visas in violation of immigration and emigration regulations have been arrested in the Andiambalama area of Katunayake.

title: New Secretaries to Ministries, PM and Cabinet appointed
byline: The appointment of the new Secretary to the Prime Minister, the Cabinet Secretary and Secretaries for 16 Ministries was held at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo today (19).

title: Ranjith Madduma Bandara’s name gazetted as SJB National List MP
byline: The Election Commission of Sri Lanka has issued a Gazette notification declaring that the General Secretary of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), Ranjith Madduma Bandara, has been elected as a Member of Parliament through the National List of the SJB.

title: ADB approves USD 200 mln loan to strengthen Sri Lanka’s financial sector reforms
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) today approved a $200 million policy-based loan to further help the Government of Sri Lanka strengthen its financial sector.

title: Met. Dept warns of possible low-pressure area nearing Sri Lanka’s Eastern coast
byline: The Department of Meteorology has announced that a low-pressure area is likely to form over southeast Bay of Bengal around 23 November.
